entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French refuser, from Vulgar Latin *refusare, perhaps blend of Latin refutare to refute and recusare to demur recuse

def.dt: :to express oneself as unwilling to accept refuse a gift refuse a promotion
:to show or express unwillingness to do or comply with refused to answer the question
:deny they were refused admittance to the game
:give up renounce deny thy father and refuse thy name Shakespeare
:to decline to jump or leap over

entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from refuser

def.dt: :the worthless or useless part of something :leavings
